caseData.primaryApplicantOtherReason: Other reason for the 1st exe name difference

value.applyingExecutorName: First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName

declaration.accept: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
declaration.confirm: We confirm that we will administer the estate of partial application  partial application, according to law. We will:
declaration.requests: If the probate registry (court) asks us to do so, we will:
declaration.confirmItem2: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
declaration.confirmItem3: keep a full account of how the estate has been administered
declaration.requestsItem1: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
declaration.requestsItem2: return the grant of probate to the court
declaration.understandItem1: our application will be rejected if we do not answer any questions about the information we have given
declaration.understandItem2: criminal proceedings for fraud may be brought against us if we are found to have been deliberately untruthful or dishonest

legalStatement.intro: This statement is based on the information First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName has given in their application. It will be stored as a public record.
legalStatement.applicant:
We, First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName of 126 caulfield road
e7 9qx
London, diff 2nd ExeFNLN of 6 Neville Road London E7 9QX and diff 3rd ExeFNLN of 6 Neville Road London E7 9QX, make the following statement:
legalStatement.deceased: partial application  partial application was born on 1 January 1900 and died on 2 February 2000, domiciled in England and Wales.
legalStatement.deceasedOtherNames: They were also known as 1st other partial name FN 1st other partial name LN and 2nd other partial name FN 2nd other partial name FN.
legalStatement.deceasedEstateValue: The gross value for the estate amounts to £32432324 and the net value for the estate amounts to £343243.
legalStatement.deceasedEstateLand: To the best of our knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in partial application  partial application which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of partial application  partial application and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.

value.executor: 4th ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application but reserves power to do so at a later date. They have been notified in writing.
5nd ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application now and gives up the right to do so in the future.
6th ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application because they died before partial application  partial application died.
7th ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application because they died after partial application  partial application died.

value.name: First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName, an executor named in the will or codicils as diff Frist exe Name, is applying for probate. Their name is different because First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName: Other reason for the 1st exe name difference.
value.sign: First Executor FirstName First Executor LastName will send to the probate registry what we have seen and believe to be the true and original last will and testament, and 7 codicils of partial application  partial application.

value.name: diff 2nd ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils as 2nd ExeFNLN, is applying for probate. Their name is different because diff 2nd ExeFNLN changed their name by deed poll.
diff 3rd ExeFNLN, an executor named in the will or codicils as 3rd ExeFNLN, is applying for probate. Their name is different because diff 3rd ExeFNLN changed their name by deed poll.
